issue.title: allow for command-line arguments to system plugins

content.raw:
To clarify, the args might have embedded spaces; Gazebo would tokenize on whitespace to produce argc and argv for the system plugins.

E.g.,

    gazebo -s libsystemplugin.so my.world -a "__name:=rosnode_name __log:=/tmp/log"

would produce an argv of length 2, with the first element being `__name:=rosnode_name` and the second being `__log:=/tmp/log`.  Correct?
